headline: Chicken Club Pasta Salad
description: This chicken pasta salad has all the delicious fixings for a chicken club sandwich combined with tender pasta and a rich and creamy dressing.

video.description: Your favorite club sandwich is a salad!
video.name: Chicken Club Pasta Salad

name: Chicken Club Pasta Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 to12 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Whisk Italian-style dressing and mayonnaise together in a large bowl.
Stir in pasta, chicken, bacon, tomatoes, cheese, celery, green bell pepper, and avocado until evenly coated.

review.reviewBody: I liked this recipe, it was fast and delicious. I appreciated something so simple to throw together!

Very good and easy and comes together quickly. Next time I would add some Italian seasoning and freshly ground pepper to the salad, but it was still good. I didn't have any avocado so did not add that and it was still good. I used turkey bacon.

I make a few alterations to the original recipe to suit but I have to make such a large batch as the kids love it. So I double up on ingredients, put extra sauce and pasta in and swap the cheese to one they like.
amazing
So simple and delicious!

This was so awesome the first day I made it! I figured it would need to sit in the fridge overnight to actually be good, so can't imagine how good it will be tomorrow! I used All recipes Absolutely Fabulous Greek House Dressing instead of bottled, which I always keep on hand. I didn't have muenster cheese so used a combination of hard cheeses I had in the fridge. I didn't have any celery, green pepper or avocado, so I used orange pepper, red onion and some leftover spinach. This recipe would go great with whatever you have in your fridge. I was thinking that artichoke hearts and cucumber might work well too. I'm definitely keeping this recipe in my regular rotation. It's that good! Thanks, Lane J!

This is be best pasta salad ever! It makes a large bowl full and when my husband saw it he scoffed "Well, we'll be throwing half of that out!". Surprise! 3 days later, we were fighting over the last tiny bowl and he reminded me to get the ingredients to make more when I went to the store the next day. I think that I will double the dressing because it got a little dry after the first day but otherwise, awesome as is!
omgoodness amazing.

This was really simple, and the entire family loved it. I gussied it up a bit with a few extra veggies since I didn't have an Avocado handy. We like chicken, so I added a bit more than called for. Other than that, just followed the simple recipe and WHAM! I got a great chicken pasta salad for lunch and snacking over the weekend.
this is a very good and Hearty salad I would recommend it to many of my friends
Very tasty! Colorful. This is the new go to salad. Thank you
Took this camping and we loved it. I substituted the rotisserie chicken for cubed ham instead. yummy!
It was very good!!
Easy recipe, very adaptable. I didn't have bacon so I used Breakfast Sausage. I also added a bit of ranch dressing. BIG HIT with the family
Delicious! Excellent main course summer meal.
I have made this several times. Very good and just enough different from others. I use it as a main dish. Am making it again tomorrow for a group I will be visiting. I will double it and

This recipe was super! I made it without the chicken because I didn't have any on hand. I also added a tbsp of bacon fat to the dressing just to bring out the bacon flavor. Not healthy I know, but it did add that extra bit of flavor. We loved it and will definitely make it again - and with chicken next time.
I used creamy Italian salad dressing and 1/2 lb of bacon. It was a side, so I omitted the chicken. I don't like celery and I didn't have an avocado, so basically it was a BLT salad.
Quite tasty. Will definitely make again. I served the avocado separately since it breaks down quickly.
Excellent recipe for left over chicken or rotisserie chicken. I actually made a homemade creamy Italian dressing since I don't use bottled dressing so I added salt and pepper to the recipe.
Loved this!! I used an onion chopped and omitted the celery and avocado. I also cooked 2 chicken breast cooked in the bacon grease. This is a keeper!
great salad! would cut down on the green peppers next time.
Great easy meal that everyone loved!
I've had this for lunch 3 days in a row and I'm still not sick of it! It keeps really well too. I substituted the cheese as suggested and replaced celery with red onion.
So yummy! And very filling! We added red onion and scallion and it came out great.
It tasted great and would have been wonderful but there was to much liquid! Made the pasta soggy and greasy!
My husband loved it. I used string cheese cut into chunks, garden peppers instead of celery and turkey bacon.
Cooked my own chicken tenders and omitted the avocados because I was afraid they would turn brown with leftovers, but the salad is amazing. Will definitely add it to my "potluck" folder.
Loved it!
Excellent recipe, made it last night and it’s almost all gone. My picky teenage son loved it and went back for more. Used croutons instead of bagel chips.
Did not make any changes, loved it and the kids loved it too. Will make it again.
I followed the recipe as written. I rate this dish as average.

This was great. A little pricey for pasta salad but I wanted a special recipe. I followed the recipe exactly except left out the avocado since I was serving it the next day. I wasn’t sure how the avocado would do overnight. If I was serving this at home, I would definitely add the avocado right before. I was also surprised how good the mayo/Italian dressing was. That may become my go to for pasta salad. Super easy. My Italian dressing said zesty. Loved this.

Easy and delicious! I substituted the Muenster for Monterey Jack, the corkscrew pasta for bowtie, and left the bacon out. Would definitely make this again for a potluck or just to eat at home! The avocados add a great texture to this dish. You want to make sure the mayo and dressing are mixed really well because they look a bit weird and are prone to separating at first. Overall super happy with this recipe, thanks!

Very good. Took forever to chop bec I'm not a pro. Used newman's zesty Italian for obvious reasons and profits go to charity, gluten-free and needed a quick fix for a retail job. Added a little red pep for extra kick, some small diced ham and scallions. Full meal.

It’s good, I like the mayo and Italian dressing combo. You can basically throw in whatever you like. I added Italian seasoning. I have made a similar recipe with ranch dressing, this however has a nice kick! Will definitely make it again. Great way to use up left pasta. Ok

Awesome! The prep work is worth it! Just the right ratio of all the ingredients. Feel free to use low fat mayo and Italian dressing. This is a good make-ahead recipe, although the avocado does turn brown after a while. Still tastes great.

The only thing I did differently is to omit the avocados. They deteriorate too quickly for only two of us. I would also recommend using a cheese other than muenster cheese as it really doesn't have much flavor. I will be making this again.

Changes except that when I first ate it I forgot to mix with pasta.
It was good it was that are mixed with pasta
Made it for a potluck at work and it was a huge success!!! I swapped mayo for creamy ranch and added creamy Italian along with using zesty Italian and minus the avocado everyone loved it!!!

I have made this 3 times and each time it is wonderful. I used Orzo pasta, made my own italian dressing, used fresh motzarella, pancetta instead of bacon, two avocados, green onions and the rest of the ingredients. did not disappoint.
Added some black pepper, Italian seasoning and some salt to taste. Quick easy meal.

This was delicious! I did make minor tweaks to it. Since I didn't have any Italian style dressing, I made it with Hidden Valley salad dressing mix. I don't like celery and had no avocado on hand. So I doubled my Muenster cheese cubes to make up for it. I would love to make it again with actual salad dressing and avocado.
I left out peppers, celery and bacon (didn't have bacon handy). I added some ripe olives. It is basically a good salad, but I would add more flavor next time such as onion powder and maybe some herbs
Excellent just by the recipe. The following day I did add a couple of tablespoons of Italian Dressing. Even better....

This pasta salad was amazing!! I omitted the celery because I didn't have any. I also didn't use the exact measurements the recipe called for. Added parmesan cheese at the end. My picky five year old loved it too. Will definitely be making this regularly!
5 star rating with the recipe as-is. The second time I made it, I added red onion as a personal preference and loved it even more!
5 star rating with the recipe as-is. The second time I made it, I added red onion as a personal preference and loved it even more!
This was delicious and everyone loved it! I used about half of the dressing and next time I might try cheddar. I’m definitely making this again!

at first I thought I wouldn't like it but after I made it. I was surprised how good it was. I had to double the recipe...lot of people to feed. The dressing was nice, I used grated cheese instead....turned or very good.
I used canned chicken and added black olives. Turned out great.
A little rich with the cheese and dressing, but overall good. Great way to use up some vegetables in the refrigerator. Light summer meal

This is one of the best things I have made from Allrecipes. The only thing I didn't add was the avocado, only because it did get ripe in time, but it would probably have been great as well. I added a bit more bacon because, let's face it, how can you go wrong with more bacon? This is great for a party, for dinner, for a snack. It is really addictive. It goes into my keeper file.

This is one of the best things I have made from Allrecipes. The only thing I didn't add was the avocado, only because it did get ripe in time, but it would probably have been great as well. I added a bit more bacon because, let's face it, how can you go wrong with more bacon? This is great for a party, for dinner, for a snack. It is really addictive. It goes into my keeper file.

I made a 1/2 recipe because only my husband and son were going to eat it. My son didn't get any. My husband went back for seconds. He really liked it. The only change was that I did not have celery so I left it out. Otherwise - great recipe that uses basics I always have in the fridge.
easy to make. Great lunch on a 90 degree day
The only thing I changed was to substitute red onion for the green pepper. Loved it! My boyfriend even went back for seconds and I have a hard time trying to get him to eat his vegetables.

Nice flavorful pasta salad that could even serve as a main meal! Great change from vinaigrette dressing pasta salads, which my Gluten Free pastas tend to absorb too much resulting in a dry salad. Since my bell pepper and avocado went bad, and I didn’t have any celery, I used cucumbers (chopped) and fresh broccoli (cut into florets, lightly steamed). I cooked the bacon in a separate pan. Reserved 1.5 tbsp bacon grease to cook 2 chicken breasts (cubed; seasoned with salt and pepper, garlic, onion, paprika, and parsley) on saute mode in my instant pot. Added 3 cups chicken broth + 12 oz Gluten Free Penne, manual for 4 minutes, but pasta wasn’t done so cooked for additional 2 minutes. Used cubed, Cabot brand LF/GF, cheddar cheese. Delicious salad that gets better the longer it sits! Next time I’ll make just a little extra dressing to add in. Thanks for the recipe!

Yum!! Made this as a side salad without the chicken, bacon and bell pepper. Used cucumber in place of the bell pepper because of allergies. It was fantastic! I'm looking forward to making again with the chicken and bacon.
A new favorite!!!
Takes longer than 20 minutes prep time. More like 1.5 hours
Great dish!!! My daughter who is a very picky eater liked this recipe. I added red peppers and spring onions. Your family will enjoy this dish as a side meal or the main meal!!!
Great dish to have ready for a pool day!
Loved it. I added some chopped apples for that extra crunch and sweetness.
not my thing. ended up bland (maybe too much chicken) and dry. I'm still not an avocado fan apparently either.
Everybody loved it. I used gluten free pasta, balsamic dressing and Monterey jack cheese instead of muenster.
Great recipe! The only thing I did different was fry diced chicken breasts in some of the bacon fat instead of using a rotisserie chicken.

I'm cooking for my daughter's wedding this July. I wanted something new but easy enough to make ahead. This recipe is just the ticket! The dressing is 2 basic ingredients that come together in under a minute. The store bought rotisserie chicken can be bought up to 3 days ahead, cleaned, cubed and ready to toss into the salad. The veggies take a little bit of time to prepare but those too can be cleaned and cut days ahead when stored properly. I think our guests will be surprised and love this recipe!
Quick, tasty and easy to substitute ingredients more to your liking. Enjoyed warm and cold.

Outstanding! I didn't change anything but I did times and a half the recipe so it lasted a wee bit longer than I had thought. Everyone loved this, which I served with homemade garlic bread. I'd recommend it for potlucks, too, as it's quite rich and a small portion suffices. I'm making it again for 4th of July.
Super yummy!
This was good, but certainly not great.

Followed the recipe using tri-color pasta, Monterrey Jack cheese (suggested substitute) and Kraft Tuscan House Italian dressing - all on hand. I added the avocado just before serving as it made a lot of salad and I didn’t want avocado sitting in the refrigerated leftovers. Great recipe - my husband loved it. Unless I’m making it for a group I’ll halve the recipe next time. Thanks for a lovely entree salad recipe!
Instead of prepping the chicken, I had some honey/cherry/pineapple glazed leftover ham. It was scrumptious .

Left out Italian salad dressing; used dry Italian spices instead. No avocado. 1 T onion.

Best pasta salad I've ever made. Even 'picky eaters' loved it!
PeggyLee
Sounded so good, but not a fan. Maybe it's the mayo and Italian salad dressing combo? Too bland for my taste.
Left out avocado only because I forgot, my bad! Salad is very tasty and will make soon for family and friends

I have made this few times now, I usually double my sauce 
(mayo Italian dressing) for those who wants extra. I truely enjoy this it's almost a meal in itself for use..I'd recommend this for any occasion!??
Pretty good and easy to make

Loved the upgrade from the traditional pasta salads. I made it and my family enjoyed it.

Thanks

OH MY! This is so yummy! i just made it and haven't even let the flavors combine in the fridge yet. 
I meant yo make tge recipe as written but... I left out the bacon as my husband's preference. I substituted Monterrey jack as that is what I have on hand. I accidentally added 3/4 cup mayo instead of only 1/4 cup. A tasty mistake!
I think this would be great with the addition of some onions and more avocado.

Loved this recipe. Of course, I never have all the ingredients on hand so used cheddar for the cheese and had to do without the avocado since I didn’t have a ripe one, but it still tasted great. I agree that the dressing with the mayonnaise was key, and the salad kept for several days for lunch.

As written this was ok but pretty bland. I found myself scrambling at the last minute trying to up the flavor factor before serving. I threw in 1/2 cup of ranch dressing, 1 tsp ground black pepper, and 1/2 tsp dill. After changes my family raved about what a keeper this was!

I was looking for a newer update to the same old cold pasta side dish when I found this recipe. I made my traditional pasta salad but used the italian dressing/mayo dressing from this recipe and it was AWESOME. Perfect update for my tired salad (tri-color bow tie pasta, mushrooms, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, artichoke hearts, red onions, hearts of palm, celery). The little bit of mayo gave more substance to the traditional italian dressing without turning it into a mayo based salad. I served it at a couples wedding shower and doubled my receipe. Needless to say, it didn't last long at all! Guess now I have to try the recipe it was written for!

Wonderful dish that received rave reviews at both parties I have made it for. The first time I made it as written and it is absolutely delicious. The second time I doubled everything but the “sauce” and bacon, omitted the celery and used sweet peppers in place of the green peppers. Again it was delicious. I mixed the pasta, chicken, peppers and cheese with the sauce hours before I planned to serve it, then added the avocado, bacon and tomatoes just before serving. (The key for me was waiting until the pasta was absolutely stone cold to add the sauce. Yes, I realize warm pasta will absorb the sauce and take on the flavor, but then it would have needed even more sauce and I was trying to watch calories in an already heavy , but delicious dish!). I will be making this again, especially for picnics, cookouts and neighborhood block parties!
I like this recipe. I made a few changes. Used green onions instead of celery and I cooked chicken with liquid smoke and next time I will not use mayo. It made it too sweet.
This was sooo awesome. I substituted chopped black olives for the avocado and instead of cherry tomatoes, I used rotel tomatoes with chilies. Scrumptious!
This was the best salad ever

we were very disappointed with the results of the salad. we did not care for the dressing at all. I thought it would be a nice cool salad on a hot day. my husband thought the salad would be ok with a different dressing. I will probably try fixing it again leaving the mayo out.
Yes—-great salad!
absolutely delicious! great as a meal on a hot summer day!
Delicious and easy dish !
Everyone LOVED it!!! Only bad part...no left overs :(
I left out the avocado (cuz I didn't have one) and added red pepper instead of green. Also added black olives. Yummy!!!
So good and pretty easy. Made a few modifications for tastes. I’d recommend adding half the bacon before serving for crunch and top with avocado
Very tasty
Very tasty
everyone love it including me it was so good it blew my mind so tasty
I seasoned it with Hungarian paprika. It was ok. Kind of an average pasta salad. Won’t make this again.
